intro: Baphorhiza lutea, commonly known as the yellow baphorhiza, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which bloom in clusters during the wet season. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Baphorhiza lutea is adapted to thrive in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in lowland rainforests.
